source.name: reflection
source.instructions:
1. Which blocks did you add to your first Scratch Project?

2. Did they work the way you expected them to work?

source.name: turning
source.instructions: Which scripts will make the Scratch cat turn around once? (there may be more than one answer)
source.guidance:
The first and third answer will make the cat turn one complete revolution:

<font size="3"><center>$24 x 15 = 360$</center> </font>
<font size="3"><center>$12 x 30 = 360$</center> </font>

The second solution will make the cat turn forever.

source.name: test fixit 2
source.instructions: Click the Check it button to submit your code to the auto-grader after you have tested it.

source.name: Fill in the Blank
source.text: If you want to make something happen multiple times you use a <<<loop>>>. To make something happen without an end you use the <<<forever>>> block. If you want something to happen a specific number of times you use the <<<repeat>>> block. If you want something to happen until a specific condition is met you use a <<<repeat until>>> block.
